link.title: Star Stalker

link.title: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

content.div:
Many of life's greatest pleasures begin with the phrase, "Babe, there's two naked people in my car right now." So we've heard, anyway -- and as such, Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth's upcoming episode of Punk'd brings with it so much golden promise (and, potentially, various public indecency violations).

Cyrus, like Justin Bieber before her, is one of a revolving series of hosts on MTV's upcoming Punk'd reboot. And in a newly released promo, we get to watch her prank her Hunger Games boyfriend, Hemsworth. Why this involves hiring two strangers to leave butt sweat all over HER car, we're not sure. But it seems to alarm Hemsworth enough to drag the cops into things. Funsies.

Other people alarmed by Cyrus' teenage hijinx? Creationists! No, no, they're not guest-starring on Punk'd (unless Kellan Lutz, Kelly Osbourne, Taylor Swift or any number of the show's future stars are hiding something. Quick -- somebody ask them about dinosaurs!). Cyrus Tweeted the following quote days ago: "You are all stardust. You couldn't be here if stars hadn't explodedâ€¦ So forget Jesus. Stars died so you could live." And instead of applauding the 19-year-old for Tweeting a quote by theoretical physicist Laurence Krauss (as opposed to, say, another picture of her erotic birthday cake), the apparently sizeable Hannah Montana demographic that intersects with the Christian right-wing had their heads explode, like so many cosmos-creating stars.

Angry Tweets ensued, to which Cyrus has since responded -- albeit without a prank engineered by Ashton Kutcher. As she wrote yesterday: "How can people take the love out of science and bring hate into religion so easily?" she asked, capping her message with a quote from Albert Einstein. "It makes me sad to think the world is this way. Like Einstein says 'Science without religion is lame. Religion without science is blind.'"

Just last week, in an unrelated situation, Cyrus called out Twitter, saying they need to take more responsibility for the bullying that takes place on their microblogging service. A Twitter user had sent Cyrus death threats, leading the pop star to Tweet the following:

"I won't tolerate someone telling me 2 die. I think Twitter needs to take some responsibility and make it a safe environment!"

Watch Cyrus' promo for Punk'd. The show airs March 29 on MTV.

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Would Taylor Swift really ruin someone's wedding? Never! She only gets up to those kind of shenanigans in songs like "Speak Now."
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Would Taylor Swift really ruin someone's wedding? Never! She only gets up to those kind of shenanigans in songs like "Speak Now."
link.title: Taylor Swift Punk'd

link.Abstract: Speak Now...like an Australian. Taylor Swift's Australian tour kicked off in Perth, March 2 at the The Burswood Dome. We've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift Plays Perth

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift has many faces, but they all look surprised.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift Looking Surprised

link.Abstract: Happy 18th birthday, Justin Bieber! What do you get a teen phenom who has everything? We've got 18 gift suggestions.
link.title: What We're Getting Justin Bieber For His Birthday

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift and Tim Tebow had dinner together Monday. If Swift ever writes a single lyric that rhymes with "Gator," we'll know it's love.
link.title: Is Tim Tebow Praying For Romance with Taylor Swift?

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift and The Civil Wars debuted their Hunger Games music video "Safe & Sound." Check it out here, along with the movie soundtrack's full tracklisting, which features contributions from Arcade Fire and The Decemberists.
link.title: Taylor Swift, World's Least Likely Hunger Games Winner, Debuts Video

link.Abstract: A cautionary tale for kids: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax is an environmental message in 3-D.
link.title: Movie Review: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift taught Zac Efron how to play guitar, so they played a little song together on Ellen. If you have a high tolerance for cuteness, watch the video on Dose.
link.title: Zac Efron Gets a Lesson in Cuteness, Guitar From Taylor Swift

link.Abstract: How can you dump someone if nobody knows you're dating? Only Taylor Swift and Eddie Redmayne know the answer.
link.title: Taylor Swift Reportedly Dumped By Dude She Probably Wasn't Dating

link.Abstract: Watch Taylor Swift's new video for "Ours," wherein everyone's favourite country-pop star plays an office drone. The work world, much like any Swift video, is a lot like high school.
link.title: Zach Gilford, Cat Videos Help Taylor Swift Make it Through the Work Day; She's Just Like Us!

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift plays Stevie Nicks dress-up for the February issue of Vogue. Check out photos of the country-pop star shot by Mario Testino.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift Turns Vogue Cover Girl

link.Abstract: "Safe and Sound" is Taylor Swift's contribution to The Hunger Games soundtrack.
link.title: Listen to Taylor Swift's New Song from The Hunger Games Soundtrack

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift is working on a new album, and try to guess what it's all about.
link.title: Taylor Swift Talks New Album with Vogue (Chances of There Being a Song Called 'Dear Jake' Just Increased Exponentially)
